Cell.Data:
Afterburner:

Afterburner provides a 50 percent increase in aircraft
top speed when activated. This comes at a cost of 3x
fuel consumption, so use it sparingly!

Evasive Roll:

Evasive Roll orders an interceptor to perform a lateral evasive roll, useful for
dodging incoming projectiles. This has a fuel cost and a cooldown, so should
be used tactically (try pausing combat to time your rolls perfectly)!

Not all interceptors are capable of performing the evasive roll maneuver.

Retreat:

Retreat orders the interceptor to disengage from combat and head to the closest
edge of the combat zone in an attempt to escape the battle. The craft will autofire
cannons at any hostile unit that enters its fire arcs but will not use its missiles.

Retreat can be cancelled by issuing new orders to the retreating interceptor,
unless it in an enforced retreat caused by running out of fuel.

Dropship %1% is approaching a %2%. Our strike team is preparing to breach the access tunnels and launch a ground assault on the alien installation.

Elimination of all alien units in the base will allow us to capture the maximum amount of recoverable technology and is the best-case scenario. Alternatively, if we can locate and destroy all the base power cores, we will be able to evacuate our troops without clearing the base. We would recover no technology in that instance, but the base would still be destroyed.

Expect large numbers of heavily-armed enemies defending the base, so be careful. Good luck, commander.

- Eliminate All Alien Units
- OR Destroy All Base Power Cores

Dropship %1% is approaching the UFO. Initial reconnaissance suggests that the alien vessel %2%

The primary objective of this mission is to capture extraterrestrial artefacts, so take care when breaching the UFO to avoid destroying valuable technology.

Good luck, commander. Bring your soldiers back alive.
sustained <font color='FAA902'>severe damage</font> during the crash. Expect many of the crew to have been killed on impact.
has landed <font color='FAA902'>undamaged</font>. It will have a full strength crew, so expect heavy resistance.
sustained only <font color='FAA902'>minor damage</font> during the crash, so expect stiff resistance.

- Eliminate All Alien Units
- OR Secure UFO And Hold For 5 Turns

Dropship %1% is approaching the UFO. Initial reconnaissance suggests that the alien vessel %2%

The primary objective of this mission is to capture extraterrestrial artefacts, so take care when breaching the UFO to avoid destroying valuable technology.

Good luck, commander. Bring your soldiers back alive.

Dropship %1% is approaching %2%. Local forces report that extraterrestrial activity is currently concentrated in a small area of the city, where they are terrorising the local populace. Our operatives have been requested to eliminate all alien units in this area.

The sole objective of this mission is to destroy all extraterrestrial units within the combat area. Tactical nuclear weapons have been deployed to the area for use if we fail. This would be a grave setback for local relations and would lead significant drop in funding.

It has been reported that there are both civilian and military suvivors in the combat area. Protect these units if possible. Good luck, commander.

Now you have to breach the UFO…

Good luck, commander. Bring your soldiers back alive.

Our installation %1% is under attack by %2%. The alien vessel has survived our anti-air defences and alien troops have been detected entering our maintenance tunnels. All non-military personnel have been evacuated to the emergency bunker beneath the base Command Centre. All military personnel in the base are preparing to repel the invaders.

The alien objective will be our Command Centre, as this contains the base reactor. It must be protected at all costs, as if destroyed it the resulting explosion will annihilate our installation. However, remember that you are fighting within a Xenonaut installation - inflicting heavy damage on our structures will knock them out of action until our maintenance crews can repair them.

The loss of one of our installations to alien attack could be catastrophic for the Xenonauts. It must not be allowed to happen. Good luck, commander.

- Alien Capture of Command Centre (3 turns)
- Loss of all units

Local politicians critical of Xenonaut failure.

This setting is for newcomers to the strategy genre.
The alien invasion escalates more slowly and the aliens are weaker than normal.

Iron Man Mode: This mode forces the player to live with their mistakes, providing a more tension. If Iron Man mode is active, the player cannot manually save their game or load previous progress. Instead, the game autosaves after every major event and on game exit, overwriting the previous autosave each time. Once you have a few games under your belt, we recommend giving it a try!

You've played strategy games before, but are not an X-Com veteran.
The game is a little more forgiving and the aliens are somewhat less dangerous than usual.

Good Luck - You're either insane or a genius.
The game starts at punishing and works up from there.

Choose this setting if you have played similar games before.
The game will be difficult - the aliens are dangerous and the invasion escalates quickly.
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Awarded for active participation in thirty combat missions.</font>

Aircraft carrier %1% and escorts bombed by alien craft; %2% personnel killed.

Air combat can either be autoresolved or fought manually in Xenonauts, depending on player preference (this is the manual method).

Combat can be paused / unpaused at any time using the Space bar. Each unit can be controlled individually, with the shaded areas representing the fire arcs of their weapons. Missiles must be in fire range and have target lock before they can be fired.

There are up to three units on each side. The selected unit can be given a destination or target with left-click, and unit speed can be controlled with the throttle beside the unit info panel. Some types of aircraft and UFO are capable of performing an evasive roll, triggered by the icon on the info panel, which can dodge incoming projectiles.

If an interceptor is shot down in air combat, it will be recovered and rebuilt - but it will be out of action for a prolonged period of time. If an interceptor is badly damaged, fly it away from danger and use the Retreat icon on the info panel.

The Geoscape shows all of the territory you are defending from invasion. Alien UFOs will periodically spawn on the map, damaging your relations with funding nations until they are shot down or complete their mission and disappear.

You will shortly be asked to place your first base. The blue circle around it represents the range of the base radar, which automatically detects UFOs that pass inside it. Try to cover as much territory as possible with your first base.

Once you have done this, you will want to speed up time until an event occurs. The arrow buttons along the top of the screen control the flow of time, so select the button with four arrows for maximum acceleration.

The objective of the game is to shoot down alien craft and capture artefacts from the crash site, then research them to unlock new technology and learn more about the alien threat. Eventually, you will learn enough about them to defeat them once and for all.

Xenonauts has turn-based combat. Each unit has a number of Time Units (TUs) which can be used to perform actions like movement and shooting. The current turn can be ended by pressing “End Turn”, which will play out the alien turn and then begin a new player turn (returning all Xenonauts to full TUs).

Left-clicking on a move destination displays the move path and the number of remaining TUs. Clicking again (or double-clicking) will move the soldier. Right-click is used to rotate soldiers on the spot or to open doors without walking through them.

Mouseover an alien to bring up the fire cursor, showing the %% hit chance and TU cost. Left-click to fire or right-click to spend more TU and make the shot more accurate. Enter free-aim mode by holding Ctrl or clicking on the soldier’s weapon image.

Ground combat is very complex and will take some time to master. Mouseover different GUI elements to get a detailed explanation of their function.
We will only have one attempt at this. Are you sure you want to launch the final mission?
The council of funding regions has evaluated your monthly performance:
Alien victory when %1% funding regions lost!
The Xenonauts have exhausted their funding.

The war drags on for several months, but ultimately proves a formality.

Humanity as we know it is utterly extinguished.

%1% civilian casualties - %2% soldiers lost

You have beaten the alien menace and secured the survival of the human race.

The brave sacrifices of the Xenonauts will not be forgotten.

The radar screens are silent. The death of the High Praetor has reduced the aliens held in our labs to a catatonic state; even our captured Praetor is utterly unresponsive. It seems the war is finally over.

Humanity is rightly celebrating our victory and the sacrifices made by the brave men and women of our organisation will echo through the ages. Though nobody has done more than I to ensure the survival of the human race, I have little doubt your name will be written into history just below my own.

This does not mean our mission is over - the world will not simply return to how it was before the invasion began. It is inevitable that our new technology will drastically alter the balance of world power; even a single singularity core produces sufficient energy to supply the entire planet for centuries.

The squabbling has already begun. Some are already lobbying for our organisation to be placed under direct Soviet or American oversight. This technology could be used for the benefit of all humanity, irrespective of race or creed...instead, our backers seek to turn my inventions to their own narrow ends.

But who better to decide the shape of our new world than those who saved it? We have bargaining chips of our own: direct control of both the cores themselves and the most sophisticated military force on the planet. I could annihilate the entire planet in the blink of an eye if I so chose. Is anyone really in a position to dictate to us?

The Xenonauts were established to protect humanity, Commander - we must prevent our species from undoing all of our good work with their boundless capacity for stupidity and self-destruction. But you should enjoy your evening, sir. The world will probably survive until morning.
The following units are outside the dropship and will be lost if the mission is aborted:
No units currently outside the dropship
Action cannot be completed: Time Units reserved for %1% shot.
%1% is bleeding from 1 wound and will take %2% HP damage per turn!
%1% is bleeding from %2% wounds and will take %3% HP damage per turn!
%1% has been revealed to the alien forces.
<font color='FAA902'>%1%</font> has reached <font color='FAA902'>%2%</font>. Begin mission?

Camera Level Control:

This displays the current camera level. The camera level can be raised or lowered using the arrows at the top or bottom of this element, allowing the different levels of the battlefield to be viewed.

Crouch Toggle:

This will command a soldier to crouch or uncrouch at the cost of 3TUs each. A crouched unit presents a smaller target to the enemy and is 25 percent harder to hit. Crouching also provides a 25 percent boost to firing accuracy.

End Turn Button:

This button ends the turn and begins the alien turn. Make sure you have performed all the actions you want to perform before pressing this!

Equipment Tile:

This tile displays the weapon(s) equipped in the soldier’s hands. Mouseovering a hostile target will bring up the fire cursor automatically, but clicking on the Equipment tile will bring up Fire Mode for the weapon – allowing you to target items of scenery. To cancel Fire Mode, press Esc or click the equipment tile again.

The number in the top-left shows the current ammo level of the weapon, while the bottom-left allows the player to switch between burst / single fire mode for eligible weapons.

Quick Grenade Slot:

This allows a player to throw a grenade from a soldier’s belt or backpack without opening the Inventory screen. The cost to throw a grenade includes the normal cost of throwing the grenade plus an additional penalty if the soldier does not have an empty hand.

To change the selected grenade, right click on the Quick Grenade slot.

Quick Reload Slot:

This allows a player to reload the currently selected weapon without opening the soldier inventory. The number of available magazines is shown in the bottom right of the slot.

There is no additional TU charge for using the Quick Reload slot.

Soldier Information Panel:

This panel displays the soldier rank, name and status bars. The status bars show the following attributes: - Red - Health - Green - Time Units - Blue - Morale When a soldier takes damage, 50 percent of this damage cannot be healed. This part of the Health bar will be greyed out after damage is sustained.

Soldier Inventory:

This will open up the soldier inventory when clicked, allowing the player to rearrange the soldier’s equipment and pick items up or drop them to the ground.

Soldier Portrait:

This is the soldier portrait. The soldier’s rank symbol is shown in the bottom right of the image.

Toggle Roof and Walls:

Toggle showing of roof and walls. There are 3 possible states, showing everything including roofs and other objects on levels higher than the current camera level (Roof Mode), showing objects only on levels that are not higher than the current camera level (Normal Mode), and showing objects only on levels lower than the current camera level or ground on the current camera level (Ground Mode).

TU Reserve Slider:< br />< br />This is used to force a soldier to reserve time units for fire. The slider allows TUs to be saved for a specific fire mode, with the numbers on the left showing the TU cost of each fire mode.< br />< br />Note that this slider does not control fire mode (use right mouse button for increasing accuracy of shots during your turn, and reaction fire always uses only snap shots or burst fire).

Previous month income:
Monthly upkeep:

<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Awarded for active participation in twenty combat missions.</font>
The laser carbine is a short-range laser weapon that excels in an assault role.
The laser pistol is a one-handed laser weapon ideal for close-quarter use or as a sidearm.
The laser rifle is general-purpose laser weapon that can be used in almost any combat situation.
The precision laser is an excellent sniping weapon, but is poor at close range.
The scatter laser is an advanced heavy weapon that is excellent at mowing down enemy infantry.
The scatter laser is a rapid-firing laser anti-personnel weapon. It represents a significant upgrade on the .50cal.
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Awarded for eliminating five alien combatants in a single operation.</font>

The following items have arrived at <font color='FAA902'>%1%</font>:
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Awarded for elimination of five extraterrestrial units in combat.</font>
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Awarded for elimination of ten extraterrestrial units in combat.</font>
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Awarded for elimination of twenty extraterrestrial units in combat.</font>
I have prepared the latest soldier rosters for your inspection, Commander.
These soldiers are available for recruitment into our organisation.
I have prepared the latest casualty list for you, Commander.
This glowing yellow material forms the core of the UFO power source. We believe it to contain vast amounts of energy.
Our scientists believe they can develop Alenium-based explosives we can use to upgrade our grenades, rockets and air-to-air missiles.
Industrial processes that will allow us to fabricate items from advanced alien materials. Likely to lead to a new generation of battlefield equipment.
Armour plating fitted to alien capital ships is unusually strong for its thickness. Studying it may allow us to develop new protective equipment.
Alien craft are built from exotic materials with remarkable properties. Performing analysis on them may allow us to identify them.
An artefact capable of generating a field that renders objects within it weightless. Research may allow us to create our own anti-gravity technology.
An analysis of alien physiology. This may shed light on the origins of these creatures and allow us to devise a method of capturing them in battle.
Advanced alien circuitry recovered from the battlefield. Studying this may help us to develop new vehicles and aircraft.
A powerful short-ranged alien assault weapon. Study of its construction may advance our knowledge of energy weapons.
A mysterious device that we believe holds the secrets of alien interstellar travel.
Study of our alien captive. We believe this could allow us to develop a method of communicating with our foes.
A preliminary study of the composition of the alien invasion fleet.
Interrogation of our captive alien Leader. We believe this will reveal information on the alien empire and bring us a step closer to defeating them.
Interrogation of the captive alien officer. This may shed some light on objectives of the aliens, and bring us a step closer to defeating them.
A powerful alien heavy weapon, roughly the size of a machinegun. Study of its construction may advance our knowledge of energy weapons.
This is a light alien weapon, likely a sidearm. Study of its construction may allow us to improve our infantry armour and advance our knowledge of energy weapons.
A light two-handed alien weapon, roughly the size of a rifle. Study of its construction may advance our knowledge of energy weapons.
Analysis of the method used to generate plasma in alien energy weapons. This may lay the foundations for energy weapons of our own.
An alien power source with a significantly higher power output than previously encountered. Studying it may allow us to produce plasma weapons of our own.
An alien artefact generating incomprehensible levels of power. We believe these devices are the ultimate alien energy source.
An alien toroidal reactior capable of sustained reactions outputing huge levels of power.
An evolution of the Combat Shield, using hardened alien materials to produce a shield that is much more resistant to alien plasma fire.
A lightweight variant of the Wolf armour, emphasising mobility over raw protective power. The design will include a jump pack that allows vertical movement.
An analysis of the captive Caesan prisoner in order to identify weaknesses. On completion, our troops will gain a damage boost against this alien species.
Development of a general-purpose interceptor to replace the F-17 Condor, expected to be substantially faster and more resistant to alien weapons.
An alien thruster that allows extremely precise maneuvers. Will be extremely useful for designing new dropship technology.
A powerful electroshock grenade, capable of both stunning biological units and damaging robotic enemies.
Development of the ultimate human interceptor, a craft capable of defeating anything that the extraterrestrials throw at us.
An evaluation of Fusion-based explosives as an upgrade to our grenades, rockets and air-to-air missiles.
An analysis of the captive Harridan prisoner in order to identify weaknesses. On completion, our troops will gain a damage boost against this alien species.
Development of a new missile turret for the Hunter scout car. This will inflict more damage than the default machinegun.
A battlefield scout car that can be deployed in battle alongside our soldiers. Has a longer sight range than soldiers and is armed with a machinegun turret.
Development of a device designed that can inhibit alien hyperdrive travel to or from the surrounding area.
A hovertank that can support our soldiers in battle. It will be both faster and tougher than its predecessors.
A project to develop improved infantry armour for our soldiers, making them more likely to survive hits from alien weapons.
Development of a series of infantry laser weapon prototypes, designed to replace our existing ballistic weapons.
Development of a new generation of kinetic battlefield weapons. We believe that these can be more powerful than our plasma weapons.
An advanced general-purpose interceptor designed to obselete all existing craft. It will be faster and tougher than its predecessors, and able to carry a cannon and two heavy torpedoes.
A high-speed interceptor capable of carrying heavy air-to-air missiles, but not equipped with a craft cannon.
Our one chance to defeat the alien menace forever. The fate of humanity rides on this mission.
An evaluation of plasma-based explosives as an upgrade to our grenades, rockets and air-to-air missiles.
Development of a series of infantry plasma weapon prototypes, designed to replace our existing laser weapons.
Interrogation of the captured Praetor. We believe this will finally reveal all of the alien secrets, both about their origins and the true reasons behind the invasion.
Development of a mechanised assault suit that can be worn by our soldiers in battle, offering excellent protection and allowing them to wield heavy weapons without penalty.

Further evolution of our laser weapon designs, producing both rapid-fire laser weapons that can be used by our infantry and aircraft and powerful pulse lasers that can be mounted on our vehicles or used to upgrade our base defence batteries.
Development of a base structure that will decode transmissions from detected UFOs and provide additional information on their crew and mission.

Further evolution of our MAG weapon designs, producing both rapid-fire MAG weapons that can be used by our infantry and aircraft and powerful MAG railguns that can be mounted on our vehicles or used to upgrade our base defence batteries.

Further evolution of our plasma weapon designs, producing both rapid-fire plasma weapons that can be used by our infantry and aircraft and powerful plasma bolts that can be mounted on our vehicles or used to upgrade our base defence batteries.
An analysis of the captive Reaper prisoner in order to identify weaknesses. On completion, our troops will gain a damage boost against this alien species.
An analysis of the captive Sebillian prisoner in order to identify weaknesses. On completion, our troops will gain a damage boost against this alien species.
An extremely advanced battlesuit that offers excellent protection and full mobility. Incorporates a jump pack and sensors that enhance the vision of the wearer.
An advanced dropship with improved speed and the capacity to carry additional soldiers into battle.
Development of non-lethal weapons that can incapacitate enemies for interrogation.
Development of the final dropship aircraft. This will be able to carry additional solders to a combat zone and deploy them into battle via drop-pods.
A new generation of infantry armour manufactured from alien materials. We expect the Wolf to offer significantly more protection than existing armour designs.
An analysis of the captive Wraith prisoner in order to identify weaknesses. On completion, our troops will gain a damage boost against this alien species.
Ah, Commander. Please, do tell me how to do my job...
Good. This organisation could do with a little more brainpower.

Awarded for neutralising an extraterrestrial psionic unit controlling
a fellow Xenonaut operative.

<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Awarded for active participation in ten combat missions.</font>
We can sell or transfer these items.

There’s nothing in the stores at this base that you need to worry about, commander.

Food, fuel, munitions – local forces supply all that to us free, and I make sure it gets to where it needs to be.

The moment we have any manufactured equipment or captured technology, you'll be able to manage it here.
Interceptor %1% has low fuel level. It will not be able to return to base if it continues the fight. Return to base now?

Awarded for fortitude shown in successful completion of a mission
when all other operatives had been killed or incapacitated.
<font color='FAA902'>%1%</font> has disappeared from radar screens. <font color='FAA902'>%2%</font> is currently on an interception course.
You've reached the maximum number of bases you can build.
New Manufacturing Projects Available to Build:
<outline color='000000' size='2'>No vehicles present at this base</outline>

C4 Charge: The C4 charge is a block of plastic explosives primarily used for demolishing structures, as it deals Incendiary damage which inflicts quadruple damage on battlefield terrain but only normal damage to units. When primed, the player selects the number of turns until the charge detonates and then drops / throws the item. Be aware that the C4 will explode even if the soldier is still holding it when the timer runs out! Damage: 65 Incendiary (4x dmg to terrain) Suppression: 200 Suppression Radius: 3.5 tiles TU Cost: 60%

Farmer Shotgun: This weapon looks like it belonged to a farmer. It does slightly less damage than a military-grade shotgun. Range: 8 Damage: 20 Kinetic (3 pellets) Suppression: 50 Suppression Mitigation: 0 Ammo Capacity: 8 shots Reaction Modifier: 1.5x Fire Modes: - 28%% TU 38 Acc x 1 shot - 40%% TU 70 Acc x 1 shot

Flashbang: The Flashbang is a grenade designed to facilitate breaching well-defended locations. While it does not cause much damage to enemy units, it generates large amounts of suppression in its blast area instead. As a suppressed enemy is unable to reaction fire at Xenonaut troops moving into their vision cone, a Flashbang will make entry into a defended location far less dangerous. Grenades can be thrown from the hand, or can be thrown from the backpack using the grenade quickslot in the combat UI (this costs more TUs than if the grenade was already in the soldier's hand, and still more if the soldier does not have an empty hand). Damage: 5 Kinetic Suppression: 100 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 4 Tiles

Frag Grenade: The Frag Grenade is an anti-personnel grenade that causes explosive damage in a small radius around the impact point. It is useful for causing damage to tightly-clustered groups of enemies, or can be thrown over obstacles to injure enemies in cover behind them. Grenades can be thrown from the hand, or can be thrown from the backpack using the grenade quickslot in the combat UI (this costs more TUs than if the grenade was in the soldier's hand, and still more if the soldier does not have an empty hand). Damage: 50 Kinetic Suppression: 60 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 1.5 Tiles

Medipack: The Medipack is an item that can be used to heal injured soldiers on the battlefield when equipped, healing for 1HP per TU spent. However, only half of the damage sustained in combat can be healed on the battlefield (the rest must be healed back at base). Soldiers frequently suffer bleeding wounds in battle, which cause an additional 5HP of damage each turn until healed. Healing a soldier with a medikit will cure bleeding wounds.

Shock Baton: The Shock Baton is a one-handed melee weapon designed to non-lethally incapacitate enemies. It can only be used from (cardinally) adjacent tiles, but will incapacitate most foes in 2-3 hits. Stun Damage: 60 Attack Cost: 20 TU

Smoke Grenade: The Smoke Grenade does not cause damage, instead generating a cloud of thick smoke within its blast radius. This smoke significantly reduces the accuracy of any shots fired through it, offering protection from incoming alien fire. Grenades can be thrown from the hand, or can be thrown from the backpack using the grenade quickslot in the combat UI (this costs more TUs than if the grenade was already in the soldier's hand, and still more if the soldier does not have an empty hand). Smoke Radius: 4 Tiles

Laser Carbine: Carbines fire three pellets per shot, giving them very high potential damage. However, they are rather inaccurate and rely on the short range accuracy bonus to be effective. This makes them very powerful assault weapons, but of limited use where there is little opportunity to close with the enemy. The 1.5x reaction modifier makes your soldiers more likely to perform reaction fire and less likely to receive it. Range: 8 Damage: 38 Energy (3 pellets) Suppression: 58 Suppression Mitigation: 0 Ammo Capacity: 6 shots Reaction Modifier: 1.5x Reload Cost: 25 TU Fire Modes: - 28%% TU 38 Acc x 1 shot - 40%% TU 70 Acc x 1 shot

Laser Pistol: Pistols are single-handed weapons with the same damage output and fire costs as rifles, but with shorter range and no burst fire. They are primarily useful as a sidearm for units equipped with precision rifles or heavy weapons, or when a unit has only one hand free (e.g. if they are carrying a combat shield in the other hand). Their 1.5x reaction fire modifier also makes them useful for scouting - they are more likely to perform reaction fire and less likely to receive it. Range: 10 Damage: 45 Energy Suppression: 23 Suppression Mitigation: 0 Ammo Capacity: 15 shots Reaction Modifier: 1.5x Reload Cost: 15 TU Fire Modes: - 28%% TU 45 Acc x 1 shot - 40%% TU 80 Acc x 1 shot

Precision Laser: Precision weapons are more accurate than rifles and do slightly more damage, making them useful at long range. Their mitigation also gives them a damage bonus against armoured (i.e. robotic) enemies. However, each shot has a higher TU cost than a rifle and the weapon lacks burst fire. It also receives no short-range accuracy bonus and has a negative modifier for reaction fire, making it a poor assault weapon. Range: 30 Damage: 55 Energy Suppression: 29 Suppression Mitigation: 15 Ammo Capacity: 6 shots Reaction Modifier: 0.5x Reload Cost: 30 TU Fire Modes: - 38%% TU 60 Acc x 1 shot - 49%% TU 105 Acc x 1 shot - 65%% TU 165 Acc x 1 shot

Laser Rifle: Rifles are versatile weapons with average damage output. They are effective at long range using single shots, but can also burst fire to suppress enemies or inflict heavy close-quarters damage. This makes them reliable weapons that do not excel at any particular role. Range: 20 Damage: 45 Energy Suppression: 23 Single / 69 Burst Mitigation: 0 Ammo Capacity: 12 shots Reaction Modifier: 1x Reload Cost: 25 TU Fire Modes: - 28%% TU 45 Acc x 1 shot - 40%% TU 80 Acc x 1 shot - 55%% TU 130 Acc x 1 shot - 60%% TU 45 Acc x 3 shots

Ballistic Machinegun: Machineguns fire long bursts that can inflict heavy damage and are excellent for suppressing enemies. However, a burst consumes 80%% of the soldier's TU to fire - limiting the mobility of the weapon. They are also Heavy weapons, meaning a strong soldier is needed to use them effectively. They use the lower of ACC and STR to determine accuracy and an additional penalty is incurred if the soldier has less than 70 STR (due to the 70 Recoil). Range: 25 Damage: 30 Kinetic Suppression: 120 Burst Mitigation: 5 Ammo Capacity: 30 shots Reaction Modifier: 0.5x Recoil: 70 Recoil Reload Cost: 35 TU Fire Modes: - 80%% TU 35 Acc x 10 shots

MAGSTORM: Machineguns fire long bursts that can inflict heavy damage and are excellent for suppressing enemies. However, a burst consumes 80%% of the soldier's TU to fire (unless paired with Predator armour) - limiting the mobility of the weapon. They are also Heavy weapons, meaning a strong soldier is needed to use them effectively. They use the lower of ACC and STR to determine accuracy and an additional penalty is incurred if the soldier has less than 70 STR (due to the 70 Recoil). Range: 25 Damage: 105 Kinetic Suppression: 120 Burst Mitigation: 18 Ammo Capacity: 30 shots Reaction Modifier: 0.5x Recoil: 70 Recoil Reload Cost: 35 TU Fire Modes: - 80%% TU 35 Acc x 10 shots

Ballistic Pistol: Pistols are single-handed weapons with the same damage output and fire costs as rifles, but with shorter range and no burst fire. They are primarily useful as a sidearm for units equipped with precision rifles or heavy weapons, or when a unit has only one hand free (e.g. if they are carrying a combat shield in the other hand). Their 1.5x reaction fire modifier also makes them useful for scouting - they are more likely to perform reaction fire and less likely to receive it. Range: 10 Damage: 30 Kinetic Suppression: 20 Suppression Mitigation: 0 Ammo Capacity: 15 shots Reaction Modifier: 1.5x Reload Cost: 15 TU Fire Modes: - 28%% TU 45 Acc x 1 shot - 40%% TU 80 Acc x 1 shot

The 1.5x reaction modifier makes your soldiers more likely to perform reaction fire and less likely to receive it. They use the lower of ACC and STR to determine accuracy and an additional penalty is incurred if the soldier has less than 70 STR (due to the 70 Recoil). Range: 25 Damage: 70 Energy Suppression: 150 Burst Mitigation: 12 Ammo Capacity: 30 shots Reaction Modifier: 0.5x Recoil: 70 Recoil Reload Cost: 35 TU Fire Modes: - 80%% TU 35 Acc x 10 shots

They are primarily useful as a sidearm for units equipped with precision rifles or heavy weapons, or when a unit has only one hand free (e.g. if they are carrying a combat shield in the other hand). It also receives no short-range accuracy bonus and has a negative modifier for reaction fire, making it a poor assault weapon. Plasma Rifle: Rifles are versatile weapons with average damage output. They are effective at long range using single shots, but can also burst fire to suppress enemies or inflict heavy close-quarters damage. This makes them reliable weapons that do not excel at any particular role. Range: 20 Damage: 70 Energy Suppression: 26 Single / 78 Burst Mitigation: 0 Ammo Capacity: 12 shots Reaction Modifier: 1x Reload Cost: 25 TU Fire Modes: - 28%% TU 45 Acc x 1 shot - 40%% TU 80 Acc x 1 shot - 55%% TU 130 Acc x 1 shot - 60%% TU 45 Acc x 3 shots

Ballistic Rifle: Rifles are versatile weapons with average damage output. They are effective at long range using single shots, but can also burst fire to suppress enemies or inflict heavy close-quarters damage. This makes them reliable weapons that do not excel at any particular role. Range: 20 Damage: 30 Kinetic Suppression: 20 Single / 60 Burst Mitigation: 0 Ammo Capacity: 20 shots Reaction Modifier: 1x Reload Cost: 25 TU Fire Modes: - 28%% TU 45 Acc x 1 shot - 40%% TU 80 Acc x 1 shot - 55%% TU 130 Acc x 1 shot - 60%% TU 45 Acc x 3 shots

Fragmentation Rocket: The Fragmentation Rocket is an anti-structure rocket that inflicts quadruple damage to structures and also sprays shrapnel in a large radius around its detonation point. This shrapnel has poor armour penetration but can kill or injure multiple enemy units at the same time if they are standing too close to one another. Damage Type: 50 Incendiary (4x damage against terrain) Suppression: 60 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 4 Tiles

Rocket Launcher: Rocket Launchers fire rockets (shown under the "Rockets" tab of the "Equipment" section) over long range. These generally have large blast areas and do medium damage to enemies and heavy damage to cover and terrain. Remember, enemies killed with explosives will not leave any recoverable items! The Rocket Launcher is a Heavy weapon, meaning a strong soldier is needed to use it effectively. It uses the lower of ACC and STR to determine accuracy and an additional penalty is incurred if the soldier has less than 70 STR (due to the 70 Recoil). Range: 30 Damage: (Rocket) Suppression: 60 Ammo Capacity: 1 rocket Reaction Modifier: N/A (no reaction fire) Recoil: 70 Recoil Reload Cost: 35 TU Fire Modes: - 50%% TU 75 Acc x 1 shot - 80%% TU 100 Acc x 1 shot

Scatter Laser: Machineguns fire long bursts that can inflict heavy damage and are excellent for suppressing enemies. However, a burst consumes 80%% of the soldier's TU to fire - limiting the mobility of the weapon. They are also Heavy weapons, meaning a strong soldier is needed to use them effectively. They use the lower of ACC and STR to determine accuracy and an additional penalty is incurred if the soldier has less than 70 STR (due to the 70 Recoil). Range: 25 Damage: 45 Energy Suppression: 120 Burst Mitigation: 8 Ammo Capacity: 30 shots Reaction Modifier: 0.5x Recoil: 70 Recoil Reload Cost: 35 TU Fire Modes: - 80%% TU 35 Acc x 10 shots

Ballistic Shotgun: Shotguns fire three pellets per shot, giving them very high potential damage. However, they are rather inaccurate and rely on the short range accuracy bonus to be effective. This makes them very powerful assault weapons, but of limited use where there is little opportunity to close with the enemy. The 1.5x reaction modifier makes your soldiers more likely to perform reaction fire and less likely to receive it. Range: 8 Damage: 25 Kinetic (3 pellets) Suppression: 50 Suppression Mitigation: 0 Ammo Capacity: 8 shots Reaction Modifier: 1.5x Reload Cost: 25 TU Fire Modes: - 28%% TU 38 Acc x 1 shot - 40%% TU 70 Acc x 1 shot

Precision Rifle: Precision weapons are more accurate than rifles and do slightly more damage, making them useful at long range. Their mitigation also gives them a damage bonus against armoured (i.e. robotic) enemies. However, each shot has a higher TU cost than a rifle and the weapon lacks burst fire. It also receives no short-range accuracy bonus and has a negative modifier for reaction fire, making it a poor assault weapon. Range: 30 Damage: 35 Kinetic Suppression: 25 Suppression Mitigation: 10 Ammo Capacity: 6 shots Reaction Modifier: 0.5x Reload Cost: 30 TU Fire Modes: - 38%% TU 60 Acc x 1 shot - 49%% TU 105 Acc x 1 shot - 65%% TU 165 Acc x 1 shot
We build anything you want, Comrade.
You must select the soldiers you wish to hire!
A long ranged and accurate alien marksman's weapon. Study of its construction may advance our knowledge of energy weapons.
A battlefield support tank utilising advanced alien materials and electronics, intended to be significantly more durable than our Hunter scout cars.
Analysis of the facilities inside the captured alien base.
A program to upgrade key structures in all of our bases with alien technology.

Plasma Charge: The Plasma Charge is a block of plasma explosives primarily used for demolishing structures, as it deals Incendiary damage which inflicts quadruple damage on battlefield terrain but only normal damage to units. When primed, the player selects the number of turns until the charge detonates and then drops / throws the item. Be aware that the charge will explode even if the soldier is still holding it when the timer runs out! Damage: 100 Incendiary (4x dmg to terrain) Suppression: 200 Suppression Radius: 3.5 tiles TU Cost: 60%
A powerful two-handed alien weapon, roughly the size of a rifle. Study of its construction may advance our knowledge of energy weapons.
You must select the soldiers you wish to transfer!
You must select the soldiers you wish to dismiss!
A captured alien communications device. This may unlock a method of decrypting alien transmissions.
Development of a powerful infantry weapon harnessing the enormous energy held within an alien singularity core.

Combat Shield: The Combat Shield is designed to protect our soldiers from alien plasma weapons. The shield will absorb damage up to its maximum hitpoints, at which point it will be destroyed. Attacks from the frontal 90 degrees of the soldier with the shield will be stopped automatically, but those from the sides and rear may bypass the shield entirely. Hit Points: 80 Front Block Chance: 100%% Side Block Chance: 60%% Rear Block Chance: 0%%

Assault Shield: The Assault Shield is designed to protect our soldiers from alien plasma weapons. The shield will absorb damage up to its maximum hitpoints, at which point it will be destroyed. Attacks from the frontal 90 degrees of the soldier with the shield will be stopped automatically, but those from the sides and rear may bypass the shield entirely. Hit Points: 160 Front Block Chance: 100%% Side Block Chance: 60%% Rear Block Chance: 0%%

They are primarily useful as a sidearm for units equipped with precision rifles or heavy weapons, or when a unit has only one hand free (e.g. if they are carrying a combat shield in the other hand). Their 1.5x reaction fire modifier also makes them useful for scouting - they are more likely to perform reaction fire and less likely to receive it. They use the lower of ACC and STR to determine accuracy and an additional penalty is incurred if the soldier has less than 70 STR (due to the 70 Recoil). Singularity Cannon: The Singularity Cannon is a heavy weapon that can only be used by Predator-armed soldiers (those without will not have sufficient TU to fire it). It functions much like an exceptionally powerful Rocket Launcher - so ensure none of your soldiers are in the blast area when pull the trigger! Range: 35 Damage: 500 Energy, 5 radius Suppression: 80 Suppression Mitigation: 100 Ammo Capacity: 1 shots Reaction Modifier: 0.5x Reload Cost: 40 TU Fire Modes: - 120%% TU 100 Acc x 1 shot

Alenium Rocket: The Alenium Rocket is an anti-structure rocket that inflicts quadruple damage to structures and also sprays shrapnel in a large radius around its detonation point. This shrapnel has poor armour penetration but can kill or injure multiple enemy units at the same time if they are standing too close to one another. Damage Type: 75 Incendiary (4x damage against terrain) Suppression: 60 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 4 Tiles

Plasma Rocket: The Plasma Rocket is an anti-structure rocket that inflicts quadruple damage to structures and also sprays shrapnel in a large radius around its detonation point. This shrapnel has poor armour penetration but can kill or injure multiple enemy units at the same time if they are standing too close to one another. Damage Type: 115 Incendiary (4x damage against terrain) Suppression: 60 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 4 Tiles

Fusion Rocket: The Fusion Rocket is an anti-structure rocket that inflicts quadruple damage to structures and also sprays shrapnel in a large radius around its detonation point. This shrapnel has poor armour penetration but can kill or injure multiple enemy units at the same time if they are standing too close to one another. Damage Type: 170 Incendiary (4x damage against terrain) Suppression: 60 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 4 Tiles

Stun Rocket: Stun rockets are a method of delivering stun gas into an area from long range. This gas inflicts stun damage on any unit that comes in contact with it each turn - though some alien units (particularly those with helmets) are partially or fully resistant to this effect. Damage Type: 40 Stun (per turn) Gas Radius: 4 Tiles

Advanced Medipack: The Medipack is an item that can be used to heal injured soldiers on the battlefield when equipped, healing for 1HP per TU spent. However, only half of the damage sustained in combat can be healed on the battlefield (the rest must be healed back at base). Soldiers frequently suffer bleeding wounds in battle, which cause an additional 5HP of damage each turn until healed. Healing a soldier with a medikit will cure bleeding wounds.

Stun Grenade: Stun rockets are a method of delivering stun gas into an area from short range. This gas inflicts stun damage on any unit that comes in contact with it each turn - though some alien units (particularly those with helmets) are partially or fully resistant to this effect. Damage Type: 40 Stun (per turn) Gas Radius: 3 Tiles

Electroshock Grenade: Electroshock grenades produce a powerful electrical pulse that inflicts stun damage on biological units and EMP damage on robotic units. Damage: 50 Stun / 115 EMP Suppression: 60 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 2 Tiles

Alenium Grenade: The Frag Grenade is an anti-personnel grenade that causes explosive damage in a small radius around the impact point. It is useful for causing damage to tightly-clustered groups of enemies, or can be thrown over obstacles to injure enemies in cover behind them. Grenades can be thrown from the hand, or can be thrown from the backpack using the grenade quickslot in the combat UI (this costs more TUs than if the grenade was in the soldier's hand, and still more if the soldier does not have an empty hand). Damage: 75 Kinetic Suppression: 60 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 1.5 Tiles

Plasma Grenade: The Frag Grenade is an anti-personnel grenade that causes explosive damage in a small radius around the impact point. It is useful for causing damage to tightly-clustered groups of enemies, or can be thrown over obstacles to injure enemies in cover behind them. Grenades can be thrown from the hand, or can be thrown from the backpack using the grenade quickslot in the combat UI (this costs more TUs than if the grenade was in the soldier's hand, and still more if the soldier does not have an empty hand). Damage: 115 Plasma Suppression: 60 Suppression Armour Mitigation: 0 Blast Radius: 2 Tiles

It is useful for causing damage to tightly-clustered groups of enemies, or can be thrown over obstacles to injure enemies in cover behind them. Grenades can be thrown from the hand, or can be thrown from the backpack using the grenade quickslot in the combat UI (this costs more TUs than if the grenade was in the soldier's hand, and still more if the soldier does not have an empty hand). The objective of this mission is to secure the UFO, which will contain artifacts to research or alien materials that you can use to build advanced technology. Other alien items recovered from the battlefield will automatically be sold, granting you additional funding.

The simplest way to win this mission is to eliminate all of the alien units on the map. This will automatically end the mission and recover all alien artifacts from the battlefield. However, you can also win the mission by killing all the aliens inside the UFO and then holding it with at least one soldier for five turns.

If the UFO has been shot down, a number of the crew are likely to have died on impact and some of the recoverable items may have exploded or been destroyed. A landed UFO will contain more recoverable items, but will also contain more aliens.

Remember to use smoke, suppression or shields to reduce the amount of reaction fire your soldiers take when they assault the UFO.

Aliens have launched a terror attack on this city, so the objective of the mission is simple: destroy all alien forces whilst protecting as many civilians and local forces as possible.

This is likely to be a difficult mission. The aliens have landed a force of well-equipped terror soldiers that will aggressively engage your forces once the battle begins. If the mission proves too challenging, you can retreat your soldiers to the dropship and abort the mission from the menu.

Local forces are also operating in the area, but are unlikely to survive long without assistance. You will receive a small amount of bonus funding for each civilian and local soldier that survives the battle (but the priority should be the elimination of the enemy).

The national military will provide aerial surveillance over the battlefield after twenty turns of combat, revealing the map and helping you hunt down any surviving aliens.

There are two ways to win an Alien Base mission. The first is the straightforward elimination of all enemy units, which will result in the recovery of all alien artifacts and materials within the base.

The second method of destroying the facility is easier, but will not result in the recovery of any items at all: destroying the base power core, housed in a side room of the base. If destroyed, the mission will always end in a Xenonaut victory (even if you abort the mission or your soldiers are all killed).

Alien bases contain a multitude of teleporters, hidden passages and locked doors that can be used or destroyed to provide additional routes and methods of flanking your enemies.

Your men are also capable of using the base sensor systems against the aliens: if you clear the aliens from the base Command Room, the entire map will be revealed.

Your base is under attack from alien invaders - you must eliminate all of the extraterrestrial units to win this mission, and a loss will mean the destruction of your facility. There are no other victory conditions for the Xenonauts, but the aliens will also win the mission if they hold your Command Centre for five turns.

The alien forces in this mission are highly aggressive and well-equipped, so expect a difficult fight. Additionally, they will attempt to destroy some of your base structures as they sweep through the map, putting them out of action for several days if they are successful.

In a base defence mission, the map starts revealed (including the alien entry points) and the player is able to arrange their troops in the Command Centre before the mission begins. However, it is the aliens that get the first turn!

This is a night mission, as this area of the world is currently in darkness on the Geoscape. Fighting a mission at night puts your soldiers at a disadvantage, as they have reduced vision whilst the aliens are unaffected.

For a tile to be visible on a night mission, it must be both within the line of sight of a Xenonaut unit and lit by a light source. As Xenonauts can see 18 tiles but their tactical lights only project light for 12 tiles, they are effectively losing a third of their vision range when on a night mission (vehicles have headlights and are not affected).

This missing vision can be restored by using another source of light. All Xenonaut units carry unlimited numbers of flares, which project light and can be thrown relatively cheaply from the Grenade Quickslot on the UI.

Many maps also have sources of environmental light (e.g. street lights) that will light up the area around them. Use this to your advantage where possible!

Commander, we have picked up unusual communication signals emanating from the landing zone. We believe that the area may contain one of the alien Officers we need to interrogate!

They are likely to be identifiable by their headgear - please do your best to capture this creature so we can continue to advance our research.

Those communication signals are back, Commander. I suspect there is an alien Leader in the area - exactly the type of creature we need to interrogate.

Please do your best to capture it so we can continue with our research. I would imagine it will be recognisable from its headgear in the same manner as the Officer.

The amount of alien communications traffic in the area is far higher than normal, Commander. The aliens seem worried about something - I strongly suspect that there is a Praetor in the vicinity.

It would strike a terrible blow against our foes if your men were able to capture it alive for interrogation; we would be close to ending this war once and for all.
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>The soldier's strength determines how much equipment they can carry without suffering a TU penalty. Stronger soldiers can also throw explosives farther away.

<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Time Units (TUs) determine how much the soldier can do in one turn in ground combat. Actions such as moving, reloading and others consume TUs, so a soldier with more TUs will be able to perform more actions. Note that shooting takes a percentage of TUs, so soldiers with more TUs do not get to shoot more often.
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>The amount of damage the soldier can take in combat. If this drops to 0 or below, the soldier is killed.
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Determines how likely this soldier is to hit the target when shooting. With heavy weapons, the lower of Accuracy or Strength is used.

<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Higher reflexes make the soldier more likely to reaction fire upon aliens that the soldier sights during the alien turn. Likewise, higher reflexes make it less likely that aliens will reaction fire upon this soldier.
<font face="fonts/arial.mvec"\>Soldier with a higher bravery score are more likely to resist psionic attacks, are harder to suppress, and are less likely to panic in combat.
Provides %1% living space Total living space: %2%/%3%
Provides %1% laboratory space Total laboratory space: %2%/%3%
Provides %1% workshop space Total workshop space: %2%/%3%
Recent alien sightings suggest they have established a base somewhere in %1%!
Reports from field agents suggest aliens may have a base near %1%, %2%!
